newsitem.title: PANAMA: Panama's new bank law could take effect this year.
newsitem.headline: Panama's new bank law could take effect this year.

text.p: Sweeping changes to Panama's banking system to prevent money laundering should take effect lter this year, a top government official said Tuesday.

"The new banking law should be finished this month; then we will consult all sectors affected," Panama's security chief Gabriel Castro told Reuters. He said a reform package could be sent to Congress by September or October.

The changes call for the creation of an independent banking commission with broader powers to supervise local banks and the authority to shut down troubled institutions. Current laws prevent the banking commission to intervene in troubled banks.
